attributes.action: A Third Referendum on Brexit should be a choice between PM's deal and No Deal!
attributes.additional_details:
The Remain side lost the 2016 Referendum.
Therefore, if the Government felt compelled to hold another Referendum on this issue, the choice to Remain should be excluded.
attributes.background:
There have been calls for another Referendum on our membership of the European Union.
This would be the third referendum on this matter since 1975.
As the people already voted to Leave, any future referendum should only have two choices:
A vote for the Prime Minister's current deal or No Deal.
